verses.kjv: Then Pilate therefore took Jesus, and scourged him.
verses.ct: So Pilate had Jesus taken and whipped.

verses.kjv: And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns, and put it on his head, and they put on him a purple robe,
verses.ct: The soldiers wove a crown out of thorns and placed it on his head, then dressed him in a purple robe.

verses.kjv: And said, Hail, King of the Jews! and they smote him with their hands.
verses.ct: They kept coming up to him and saying, "Long live the King of the Jews!" and they struck him in the face.

verses.kjv: Pilate therefore went forth again, and saith unto them, Behold, I bring him forth to you, that ye may know that I find no fault in him.
verses.ct: Pilate went outside again and told the crowd, "Look, I'm bringing him out to you so you can see that I find nothing wrong with him."

verses.kjv: Then came Jesus forth, wearing the crown of thorns, and the purple robe. And Pilate saith unto them, Behold the man!
verses.ct: Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. Pilate said to them, "Look at this man!"

verses.kjv: When the chief priests therefore and officers saw him, they cried out, saying, Crucify him, crucify him. Pilate saith unto them, Take ye him, and crucify him: for I find no fault in him.
verses.ct: When the chief priests and the temple guards saw him, they shouted, "Crucify him! Crucify him!" Pilate told them, "You take him and crucify him yourselves, because I find nothing wrong with him."

verses.kjv: The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.
verses.ct: The Jewish leaders replied, "We have a law, and according to that law he deserves to die because he claimed to be the Son of God."

verses.kjv: When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he was the more afraid;
verses.ct: When Pilate heard this, he became even more frightened.

verses.kjv: And went again into the judgment hall, and saith unto Jesus, Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him no answer.
verses.ct: He went back inside the governor's headquarters and asked Jesus, "Where are you from?" But Jesus didn't give him an answer.

verses.kjv: Then saith Pilate unto him, Speakest thou not unto me? knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee, and have power to release thee?
verses.ct: Pilate said to him, "You won't talk to me? Don't you realize I have the authority to release you and the authority to crucify you?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered, Thou couldest have no power at all against me, except it were given thee from above: therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath the greater sin.
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "You would have no authority over me at all unless it had been given to you from above. That is why the one who handed me over to you carries the greater sin."

verses.kjv: And from thenceforth Pilate sought to release him: but the Jews cried out, saying, If thou let this man go, thou art not Caesar’s friend: whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against Caesar.
verses.ct: From that point on, Pilate tried to release him. But the Jewish leaders kept shouting, "If you let this man go, you are no friend of Caesar! Anyone who claims to be a king is opposing Caesar!"

verses.kjv: When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he brought Jesus forth, and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called the Pavement, but in the Hebrew, Gabbatha.
verses.ct: When Pilate heard this, he brought Jesus outside and sat down on the judge's seat at a place called the Stone Pavement — in Hebrew, Gabbatha.

verses.kjv: And it was the preparation of the passover, and about the sixth hour: and he saith unto the Jews, Behold your King!
verses.ct: It was the day of preparation for the Passover, around noon. Pilate said to the Jewish leaders, "Look at your King!"

verses.kjv: But they cried out, Away with him, away with him, crucify him. Pilate saith unto them, Shall I crucify your King? The chief priests answered, We have no king but Caesar.
verses.ct: But they shouted, "Get rid of him! Get rid of him! Crucify him!" Pilate asked them, "Should I crucify your King?" The chief priests answered, "We have no king except Caesar."

verses.kjv: Then delivered he him therefore unto them to be crucified. And they took Jesus, and led him away.
verses.ct: So Pilate handed Jesus over to them to be crucified. They took custody of Jesus and led him away.

verses.kjv: And he bearing his cross went forth into a place called the place of a skull, which is called in the Hebrew Golgotha:
verses.ct: Carrying his own cross, Jesus went out to a place called The Skull — in Hebrew, Golgotha.

verses.kjv: Where they crucified him, and two other with him, on either side one, and Jesus in the midst.
verses.ct: There they crucified him, along with 2 others, one on each side, with Jesus in the middle.

verses.kjv: And Pilate wrote a title, and put it on the cross. And the writing was, JESUS OF NAZARETH THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.ct: Pilate had a sign made and fastened to the cross. It read: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.kjv: This title then read many of the Jews: for the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city: and it was written in Hebrew, and Greek, and Latin.
verses.ct: Many of the Jewish people read this sign because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and it was written in Hebrew, Greek, and Latin.

verses.kjv: Then said the chief priests of the Jews to Pilate, Write not, The King of the Jews; but that he said, I am King of the Jews.
verses.ct: The chief priests of the Jews told Pilate, "Don't write 'The King of the Jews.' Instead, write that he said, 'I am King of the Jews.'"

verses.kjv: Pilate answered, What I have written I have written.
verses.ct: Pilate replied, "What I have written stays written."

verses.kjv: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments, and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also his coat: now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.
verses.ct: After the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothing and divided it into 4 shares, one for each soldier. They also took his inner garment, which was seamless, woven in one piece from top to bottom.

verses.kjv: They said therefore among themselves, Let us not rend it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be: that the scripture might be fulfilled, which saith, They parted my raiment among them, and for my vesture they did cast lots. These things therefore the soldiers did.
verses.ct: They said to each other, "Let's not tear it apart. Instead, let's throw dice to see who gets it." This happened so that the Scripture would be fulfilled: "They divided my clothing among them and cast lots for my garment." That is exactly what the soldiers did.

verses.kjv: Now there stood by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Cleophas, and Mary Magdalene.
verses.ct: Standing near the cross of Jesus were his mother, his mother's sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

verses.kjv: When Jesus therefore saw his mother, and the disciple standing by, whom he loved, he saith unto his mother, Woman, behold thy son!
verses.ct: When Jesus saw his mother and the disciple he loved standing nearby, he said to his mother, "Dear woman, here is your son."

verses.kjv: Then saith he to the disciple, Behold thy mother! And from that hour that disciple took her unto his own home.
verses.ct: Then he said to the disciple, "Here is your mother." From that moment on, that disciple took her into his own home.

verses.kjv: After this, Jesus knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the scripture might be fulfilled, saith, I thirst.
verses.ct: After this, knowing that everything had now been completed, and to fulfill the Scripture, Jesus said, "I'm thirsty."

verses.kjv: Now there was set a vessel full of vinegar: and they filled a spunge with vinegar, and put it upon hyssop, and put it to his mouth.
verses.ct: A jar of sour wine was sitting there, so they soaked a sponge in it, put it on a stalk of hyssop, and held it up to his mouth.

verses.kjv: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished: and he bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.
verses.ct: After Jesus tasted the sour wine, he said, "It is finished." Then he bowed his head and took his last breath.

verses.kjv: The Jews therefore, because it was the preparation, that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day, (for that sabbath day was an high day,) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.
verses.ct: Since it was the day of preparation, and the Jewish leaders didn't want the bodies left on the crosses during the Sabbath — especially because that particular Sabbath was a major holy day — they asked Pilate to have the men's legs broken so the bodies could be removed.

verses.kjv: Then came the soldiers, and brake the legs of the first, and of the other which was crucified with him.
verses.ct: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man and then the other man who had been crucified alongside Jesus.

verses.kjv: But when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was dead already, they brake not his legs:
verses.ct: But when they got to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.

verses.kjv: But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and forthwith came there out blood and water.
verses.ct: Instead, one of the soldiers thrust a spear into his side, and immediately blood and water flowed out.

verses.kjv: And he that saw it bare record, and his record is true: and he knoweth that he saith true, that ye might believe.
verses.ct: The one who witnessed this has given his testimony, and his testimony is true. He knows that he is telling the truth, so that you also may believe.

verses.kjv: For these things were done, that the scripture should be fulfilled, A bone of him shall not be broken.
verses.ct: These things took place to fulfill the Scripture: "Not one of his bones will be broken."

verses.kjv: And again another scripture saith, They shall look on him whom they pierced.
verses.ct: And another Scripture says, "They will look at the one they pierced."

verses.kjv: And after this Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus: and Pilate gave him leave. He came therefore, and took the body of Jesus.
verses.ct: After this, Joseph of Arimathea — who was a disciple of Jesus but had kept it secret because he was afraid of the Jewish leaders — asked Pilate for permission to take Jesus' body. Pilate granted his request, so Joseph came and took the body.

verses.kjv: And there came also Nicodemus, which at the first came to Jesus by night, and brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about an hundred pound weight.
verses.ct: Nicodemus, the man who had first visited Jesus at night, also came. He brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes weighing about 100 pounds.

verses.kjv: Then took they the body of Jesus, and wound it in linen clothes with the spices, as the manner of the Jews is to bury.
verses.ct: The 2 of them took the body of Jesus and wrapped it in linen strips along with the spices, following the Jewish burial custom.

verses.kjv: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden; and in the garden a new sepulchre, wherein was never man yet laid.
verses.ct: At the place where Jesus was crucified, there was a garden, and in the garden was a new tomb where no one had ever been buried.

verses.kjv: There laid they Jesus therefore because of the Jews’ preparation day; for the sepulchre was nigh at hand.
verses.ct: Since it was the Jewish day of preparation and the tomb was close by, they placed Jesus there.
